newer_release.name: Runtimes 1.3.4
newer_release.body:
# Changelog

Changelog for the runtimes governed by the Polkadot Fellowship.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/).

## [1.3.4] 01.11.2024

### Changed

- Change Polkadot inflation to 120M DOT per year ([polkadot-fellows/runtimes#471](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/471))
- Update foreign asset ids in Asset Hub Polkadot and Asset Hub Kusama from v3 to v4 locations ([polkadot-fellows/runtimes#472](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/472))

# Runtime info
*These runtimes were built with **rustc 1.81.0 (eeb90cda1 2024-09-04)** using **[srtool v0.16.0](https://github.com/paritytech/srtool)***

To replicate the build, use the following command:
```sh
srtool build
       --root --profile production
       --package CRATE_NAME --runtime-dir PATH_TO_CRATE
       --build-opts="--features=on-chain-release-build"
```

ai_analysis:
Here's my analysis of the changes between v1.3.3 and v1.3.4:

1. **Executive Summary for Non-Technical Users**

Main Changes:
- The Polkadot network now has a fixed yearly DOT token emission of approximately 120 million DOT per year, replacing the previous variable inflation model
- Technical updates to asset handling systems on Kusama and Polkadot networks
- Various maintenance improvements and cleanup of legacy code

Benefits:
- More predictable and transparent token emission rate for Polkadot
- Improved stability and efficiency in cross-chain asset transfers
- Better overall system maintenance and code quality

No immediate actions required from regular users.

2. **Key Changes Explained**

Major Updates:
- New Inflation Model: Polkadot moved from a variable to a fixed inflation rate of 120M DOT annually, with 15% going to treasury and 85% to stakers
- Asset System Modernization: Updated asset identification system from v3 to v4 format in Asset Hubs
- System Cleanup: Removed unused "im-online" pallet functionality that was previously deprecated

There are no breaking changes that affect user functionality.

3. **Technical Summary for Developers**

Key Technical Changes:
- Implementation of constant yearly DOT emission (~328,797 DOT per day)
- Migration of foreign asset IDs from XCMv3 to XCMv4 format
- Rust toolchain updates (stable 1.81.0, nightly 2024-09-11)
- Clippy configuration switched from nightly to stable channel

Migration Notes:
- No storage migrations required for asset ID updates (v3 and v4 use compatible encoding)
- Legacy im-online pallet completely removed after previous deprecation

4. **Code Impact Analysis**

Most Affected Components:
- Polkadot Runtime: Significant changes to inflation mechanism
- Asset Hubs: Major updates to asset identification systems
- Build System: Toolchain and CI pipeline improvements

Change Types:
- New Features: Fixed inflation implementation
- Refactoring: Asset system modernization, removal of legacy code
- Infrastructure: Build tool and dependency updates

The majority of changes were focused on economic parameter adjustments and technical modernization rather than functional changes to user-facing features.

All changes appear to maintain backward compatibility while improving system maintainability and predictability.

pr_details.title: Switch clippy from +nightly to $RUST_STABLE_VERSION
pr_details.author: bkontur
pr_details.body:
Relates to: https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/6127

- [X] Does not require a CHANGELOG entry

pr_details.title: Remove `im-online` completely
pr_details.author: s0me0ne-unkn0wn
pr_details.body:
After 1.3.0 was enacted and offchain migration clearing `im-online` offchain storage was run, it is safe to remove any mention of the `im-online`.

- [x] Does not require a CHANGELOG entry

CC @ordian

pr_details.title: Polkadot: Constant yearly emission
pr_details.author: ggwpez
pr_details.body:
Sets the inflation to ~120M DOT per year as specified in [Ref 1139](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1139). 15% of that goes to the treasury and the rest to stakers. ## Details This MR sets the Polkadot inflation to a fixed amount per year. The yearly increase is ~120,063,259 DOT. The amount was set to 8% of the Total Issuance at block [22810263](https://polkadot.statescan.io/#/blocks/22810263) in which referendum [1139](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1139) was executed. You can check this for yourself: Multiplying this by 8% and converting to DOT is about **`120,093,259` DOT per year**. This results in an emissions of `120,093,259 / 365.25` about **`328,797` DOT per day**. The Total Issuance and yearly inflation look like this over the next 25 years: ![inflation](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32572833-0a62-4823-9b7e-00350fcf1b9d)
Concrete numbers

```pre Initial 1.501 BDOT Year 1: 1.621 BDOT +7.407% Year 2: 1.741 BDOT +6.897% Year 3: 1.861 BDOT +6.452% Year 4: 1.982 BDOT +6.061% Year 5: 2.102 BDOT +5.714% Year 6: 2.222 BDOT +5.405% Year 7: 2.342 BDOT +5.128% Year 8: 2.462 BDOT +4.878% Year 9: 2.582 BDOT +4.651% Year 10: 2.702 BDOT +4.444% Year 11: 2.822 BDOT +4.255% Year 12: 2.942 BDOT +4.082% Year 13: 3.062 BDOT +3.922% Year 14: 3.182 BDOT +3.774% Year 15: 3.303 BDOT +3.636% Year 16: 3.423 BDOT +3.509% Year 17: 3.543 BDOT +3.390% Year 18: 3.663 BDOT +3.279% Year 19: 3.783 BDOT +3.175% Year 20: 3.903 BDOT +3.077% Year 21: 4.023 BDOT +2.985% Year 22: 4.143 BDOT +2.899% Year 23: 4.263 BDOT +2.817% Year 24: 4.383 BDOT +2.740% Year 25: 4.503 BDOT +2.667% ```

## Implications 15% of the inflation goes to the treasury which results in a yearly treasury inflow of ~18M DOT (1.5M DOT per month). Stakers will receive ~102M DOT per year (~8.5M DOT per month).

pr_details.title: Release 1.3.4
pr_details.author: ggwpez
pr_details.body:
Release for the updated inflation formula from https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/471

This release only affects the Polkadot runtime.

pr_details.title: Update foreign asset ids from v3 to v4
pr_details.author: franciscoaguirre
pr_details.body:
Addresses https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/issues/209

Foreign assets in Asset Hub Kusama and Asset Hub Polkadot use v3 locations as ids. The newest version is v4 so this PR updates them.

No storage migration is needed since v3's and v4's encoding is the same.

Had to copy some test functions that took v3 locations into the repo until we update it to stable2409, when they actually switch to taking v4 locations.

pr_details.title: Trigger 1.3.3 release
pr_details.author: kianenigma
pr_details.body: Hopefully this is the last patch needed, and relay can then be updated to `spec_version: 1_003_003`.

pr_details.title: Update try-runtime-cli
pr_details.author: ggwpez
pr_details.body:
- Update try-runtime-cli for MBM testing that was added https://github.com/paritytech/try-runtime-cli/pull/90
- Fix KAH spec version that was incorrectly bumped
- Disable MBM testing for Encointer runtime until https://github.com/paritytech/try-runtime-cli/issues/101 is fixed (single-block-migrations are still checked).

- [x] Does not require a CHANGELOG entry

pr_details.title: Update Rust version
pr_details.author: AndreiEres
pr_details.body:
Fixes #470

- Fixed formatting
- Doc comments were split making first doc comment not too long
- Fixed lists in doc comments
- Unreachable patterns silenced with `#[allow(unreachable_patterns)]` (controversial)
- `time` updated to 0.3.36

<!-- Remember that you can run `/merge` to enable auto-merge in the PR -->

Instead, if you have already modified it, simply delete the following line. -->
